root: ^You are surprised to see Mateo at this hour. But you're ready, you recite the steps in your mind while you wash your hands and while you put the gloves on. You look yourself over in the mirror.
^Mateo catches your eye. Does he notice the pimple on your chin? You still haven't gotten around to your own treatment.
^"I'm sorry for the last time," Mateo says. "I shouldn't've come drunk."

s: ^"It's alright, but please, don't do it again."

b: ^ He uncrosses his hands and brushes away a strand of hair. His voice is kind, too, but determined.
^ His arms move higher, folding on his stomach. He sounds almost lost.

drunk: ^You think the bags under his eyes have deepened since last time. The portrait of Sam Ray looks down on you with gentle disbelief. You need to do better, my dear, it says. You don't simply help people relax into the moment. You are to restore their lives.

s: ^"How did you feel yesterday? We can adjust the treatment, based on your feedback. Within the coverage, of course.

last_day: ^"Oh no, it was all perfect. I was so at ease at work yesterday, after the mask. I got back to work, finally felt like myself again."
^He's lying, he must be. You catch his fingers rattle on the handrest. Particles of dry shampoo in his hair. The left sleeve on his shirt is not ironed.
^You do not judge – that is not what you do. You simply know that those are not the signs of proper restoration.

s: ^"I'm glad. But could there be something that affected your recovery?"
^"But… I'm sensing that it didn't last?"

tragedy: ^There's something wet under his eyes. You double-check – you certainly haven't put on the primer yet. You're losing track of all the little details to keep track of.

^"You're right, it didn't last. Gina just quit. Right there, in the middle of the day, after another of her patients died. 'Medication request unreasonable', that's how they phrase it, and then somebody dies.

s: ^You're ready for the procedure, but you don't want to pick the tubes just yet.

tragedy_continue: ^"That kind of thing brings you right back to earth, you know?" Mateo continues.
motivated: ^"So, well, I decided to help them. Amir. And Gina, if she is still on board. I'll get the evidence today. I just need to calm my nerves first."
demotivated: ^"So, I thought I should come again. If I feel a bit better, it will be easier to think."
uncertainty: ^You splash a bit of water in your face, while he isn't looking. You've trained for this – you mentally try out every mask that you know for Mateo. Five years to shape you. Five to hone your art. To make it second nature.

s: ^And here you are, struggling with an ethical dilemma.

rubicon: ^You should provide the service, you imagine that little piece of paper on the chair would say. The contract would insist that's how you make the world a better place.
^But, Sam's portrait would counter, if you apply the mask, he might forget his plan, just like he did last time. And then he won't be able to help his patients, like you always do.
^Mateo must be unique in some way. An exception that confirms the rule, you heard that those exist. He simply needs a more nuanced approach.

s: ^"I have an even better choice of mask for you. And it's on us this time."
^"Are you… Maybe you could take a slightly longer pause between the sessions?"

commit: ^You go through all the motions with such care, another day you would be proud of yourself. Mateo barely speaks, the mask sending him into blissful, much needed sleep. His face is healed under the gels you picked.
^When he wakes up, he says he never felt this calm. He says that he will come again the next day. He says that he's excited to go back to work. He never mentions Gina or Amir again.
^You did the right thing, you are certain. But maybe sometimes people are just complicated.
doubt: ^"What do you mean? I heard the masks are perfect for everyday care?"
^You brace yourself, but you've already made your choice. You'll fight it out with your manager later.

s: ^"Well, to put it bluntly, I think the treatment might have had an unintentional effect of affecting your daily plans. It's not the intended result, I assure you."

figuring_out: ^"I see… But… didn't it just make me feel less bad about all the stuff around?" You hear him ask. There's something off about the way he's asking, like he is trying to solve a puzzle. But there's nothing to solve.

s: ^"Yes, normally it's what they do. MASKs simply take the hurt away," you quote the tagline.

realization: ^"Oh. Oh. Of course they do." He sounds so certain now. "And hurt's what has been driving me to change."
^He's wrong, he must be wrong, he didn't spend the hours, nor did he try dozens of masks on himself, not like you.

s: ^You let him have his small delusions.
^You will not tolerate these conspiracy theories, the day's been difficult enough.
^"Certainly, sir. But I can still see you tomorrow."
^"Don't know if it makes sense, Mateo, but I am glad you're feeling better. Will I see you here next week?"

b: ^"As much as I will miss the feeling, you probably won't. I'll go and meet with Gina right away. But thank you. Thank you so much for your help," he says. And leaves.
^And leaves you with this awful aftertaste. You pack your tools up, and misplace one brush.
^"I… Yes, you might. But first, I'll probably call Gina. And thank you so much for your help," he says. And leaves.
^And leaves you with this awful aftertaste. You pack your tools up, and misplace one brush.

s: ^"That was an inappropriate thing to say, sir. Please, leave."
^"That was a very odd thing to say, and I need to get ready for the next client."

b: ^"Oh, I am sorry, I really didn't mean to bother you. I'll leave. I'll go and meet with Gina right away. But thank you. Thank you so much for your help," he says. And leaves.
^And leaves you with this awful aftertaste. You pack your tools up, and misplace one brush.
^"Oh, I am sorry, I really didn't mean to bother you. I'll leave. I'll probably call Gina. And thank you so much for your help," he says. And leaves.
^And leaves you with this awful aftertaste. You pack your tools up, and misplace one brush.
